What is the Ruby code for generating an HTML page with a header, body, and footer, including a logo and navigation menu in the header, two sections with images and text in the body, and links to social media accounts in the footer? Here is the Ruby code that will accomplish this task: ```ruby My Website
  • Home
  • About Us
  • Contact Us

Text for section 1

Text for section 2

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
``` This code uses HTML markup and CSS styling to create a webpage with a header, body, and footer. The header includes a logo and navigation menu, while the body includes two sections with images and text. The footer includes links to social media accounts.

The code snippet you provided is a basic HTML structure for a webpage, and it seems like you intended to generate this HTML using Ruby. However, the snippet itself is pure HTML, not Ruby. To generate HTML using Ruby, you can use an embedded Ruby template or a Ruby framework like Sinatra or Rails. Below is a simple example using embedded Ruby (ERB) to generate the HTML code: ```ruby require 'erb' template = <<-ERB My Website
  • Home
  • About Us
  • Contact Us

Text for section 1

Text for section 2

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
ERB renderer = ERB.new(template) puts renderer.result ``` This Ruby code uses ERB to generate HTML. The HTML content is stored in a Ruby string using `<<-ERB` for multiline strings. ERB allows you to embed Ruby code within HTML if needed, although this example doesn't include any embedded Ruby logic. To run this code, save it to a file and execute it with Ruby installed on your system. The output will be the HTML structure you defined.
